titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Brothers, Inc. (RBI) (and successors) records FA480

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-03-01 05:41:22 UTC.

physdesc.extent: 512 letter document boxes, 27 legal document boxes, and 1 half-letter document box.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Capital and standard investing activities of the Rockefeller family began in the 1930s and as efforts expanded after the conclusion of World War II, Rockefeller Brothers Incorporated (RBI) was formed in January 1946 by Laurance S. Rockefeller, Abby Rockefeller Mauze, David Rockefeller, John D. Rockefeller 3rd, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Winthrop Rockefeller, Ted Walkowicz and Harper Woodward to manage the venture capital investments of the Rockefeller family.

RBI started with a capitalization of $1.5 million, and continued operation for approximately 20 years from 1946-1966. In 1969 the Rockefeller family's investments were consolidated into a new organization known as Venrock. Venrock continued Rockefeller efforts to identify and fund entrepreneurs and help to establish the next generation of innovative and enduring companies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From 1946 through the mid-1980s, all of the filing for the Rockefeller family venture capital investments and the standard investments, as well as the multiple venture firms, was handled by one filing department.

Following procedures established by office management, the standard investment material was routinely destroyed while most of the venture capital material was sent to the Rockefeller family archives. The Rockefeller Brothers, Inc. (and successors) records consists of this venture capital material.

Investments focused in advancements of science and technology, primarily in the areas of aviation, aerospace, communications, computing and data processing, electronics, energy, lasers, optics and physics.

Files for each investment company often include: agreements, by-laws and certificates of incorporation, board of directors and commmittee records, correspondence, financial statements and reports, financing materials, meeting records, workpapers, and documenation of proposals, mergers or dissolutions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Rockefeller Family & Associates physically transferred the Rockefeller Brothers Inc. and successors files to the Rockefeller Archive Center in multiple accessions in 1985.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has legal title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.
The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish select material from the collection which has been previously viewed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research in accordance with the terms of donation from the David Rockefeller estate (January 2019). Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

physdesc.extent: 251 letter document boxes and 4 legal document boxes
